doc:
Jeramie Rain https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeramie_Rain 0 Jeramie Rain (born Susan Davis; August 23, 1948) is an American screenwriter, producer, philanthropist and former actress. Rain began her career with starring roles in several local stage productions in Charleston before moving to New York City in the early 1970s. After appearing in a string of commercials, she made her film debut in the crime film The Abductors (1972) before becoming known for roles as Sadie in Wes Craven's controversial horror film The Last House on the Left (1972) and Willie Mae in Albert T. Viola's comedy film Preacherman Meets Widderwoman (1973). Outside of film, Rain had a supporting role as Nurse Samantha Tolliver in the NBC soap opera The Doctors (1972–73), followed by guest appearances on several soap operas including General Hospital, and starring roles in Off-Broadway productions including 22 Years and The Fan Club. Rain quit acting in the mid 1970s and subsequently worked as a writer and producer for NBC and CBS. At the age of 28, Rain was diagnosed with systemic lupus and has launched several philanthropic efforts to bring awareness to the disease. Jeramie_Rain ( born Susan_Davis ; August_23_,_1948 ) is an_American_screenwriter , producer , philanthropist and former_actress . Rain began her_career with starring roles in several_local_stage_productions in Charleston before moving to New_York_City in the_early_1970s . After appearing in a_string of commercials , she made her_film_debut in the_crime_film The_Abductors ( 1972_) before becoming_known for roles as Sadie in Wes_Craven 's_controversial_horror_film The_Last_House on the_Left_(_1972_)_and_Willie_Mae in Albert_T._Viola 's_comedy_film_Preacherman Meets Widderwoman_(_1973_) . Outside of film , Rain had a_supporting_role as Nurse_Samantha_Tolliver in the_NBC_soap_opera The_Doctors_(_1972 – 73_) , followed by guest_appearances on several_soap_operas including General_Hospital , and starring roles in Off-Broadway_productions including 22_Years and The_Fan_Club . Rain quit_acting in the_mid_1970s and subsequently_worked as a_writer_and_producer for NBC_and_CBS . At the_age of 28 , Rain was_diagnosed with systemic_lupus and has_launched several_philanthropic_efforts to_bring awareness to the_disease .
